data.title: Broussard’s Mortuary Major Dr.
data.text:
Billy Wayne Barton, aged 71, passed away on August 8, 2024, in Kountze, Texas. Born in Dallas, Texas to Bonnie Coats Tibbs, he lived a life marked by dedication, humor, and love. Billy graduated from South Park High School and soon after embarked on a career as an electrician with the City of Beaumont, where he remained for over 40 years. His work not only supported the city’s infrastructure but also allowed him to forge lifelong friendships. A devout attendee of Cornerstone Baptist Church in Kountze, Billy’s faith was a significant aspect of his life, guiding him in his daily actions. Billy was a spirited individual who enjoyed the rodeo scene as a team roper. Known for loving a good prank, he cherished moments spent with his family, ensuring laughter was a constant presence in their lives. He is survived by his wife of 38 years, Sandra Linscomb Barton; daughter, […]

Anthony “Tony” Dempsey, 59, of Beaumont, died Tuesday, August 6, 2024. He was born on May 15, 1965, in Houston to Ginger Manning and Kenneth Dempsey. Tony was a heavy equipment operator with a big personality and a lifelong Houston Texans fan. Survivors include his wife, Amy Dempsey; children, Anthony Dempsey, Jr. and his wife, Lisa, of Sour Lake; Justynn Deshotel and her husband, David, of Baytown; K’Dee Rodriguez of Humble; Billy Sather of Jasper; and Christa Collier and her husband, Caleb, of Jasper; brothers, Kenneth Dempsey of Buna; John Dempsey of Beaumont; Bill Dempsey; and Ronald Dempsey of Buna; and twenty-one grandchildren. Tony is preceded in death by his parents, and brother, Darren Dempsey. Memorial contributions may be made to the Humane Society of Southeast Texas, 2050 Spindletop Avenue, Beaumont, Texas 77705. A gathering of Mr. Dempsey’s family and friends will be from 2:00 p.m. until 5:00 p.m., Saturday, […]

Mary Louise Hernandez Tillery, 96, of Beaumont, died Tuesday, August 6, 2024. A Rosary for Mrs. Tillery will be recited at 5:00 p.m. with a gathering of her family and friends to follow until 7:00 p.m., Thursday, August 15, 2024, at Broussard’s, 1605 North Major Drive, Beaumont. A Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated at 2:00 p.m., Friday, August 16, 2024, at Cristo Rey Catholic Church, 767 Avenue A, Beaumont, with her interment to follow at Forest Lawn Memorial Park, Beaumont.

Jerry Allen Yancey was born on February 19, 1943, in San Diego, California to John Woodrow Yancey, Sr. and Alice Gertrude Barnett. He went to his heavenly home on August 6, 2024, in China, Texas, surrounded by his loving family. He was eighty-one years old. Jerry was part of the last graduating class of China High School in 1961. When he graduated high school, he joined the military in 1961 and served eight years in the United States Navy. Jerry was a Beaumont firefighter for several years and retired from Lower Neches Valley authority after thirty-one years. Jerry was a lifelong member of First Baptist Church of China. He accepted Jesus as his personal Savior at an early age. Jerry would tell anyone he met about his Jesus. When he retired in 2005, he started a Cross Ministry. He passed out wooden pocket crosses, called my caring cross, to anyone […]

Luther “Al” Beale, Jr., 76, of Hemphill, died Monday, August 5, 2024. He was born on April 6, 1948, to Mari Lee Cribbs Beale and Luther Alton Beale, Sr., in Atlanta, Georgia, and was a veteran of the United States Navy. Survivors include his wife, Sheryl A. Beale-Knapp of Georgia; daughters, Kimberly Parker and her husband, Tim, of Jacksonville and Victoria Wallace and her husband, Ryan, of Beaumont; sons, Jerrod and Michael Knapp and daughter, Beth Knapp-Bowen all of Georgia; brothers, Ronald Beale of Canyon Lake and Greg Miller of Florida; sister, Robin Hooper and her husband, Tim, of Florida; many grandchildren and great-grandchildren; and numerous nieces and nephews. He is preceded in death by his parents, Luther Alton Beale, Sr. and his wife, Elizabeth (Libby) Beale; son, Anthony Scott Beale; sisters, Lynne Murray and Laura Paisley; and brother, Richard Reginald Beale. Memorial contributions may be made to the Dr. […]

Charlene Elaine Moyers, 80, of Beaumont, died Monday, August 5, 2024. She was born on March 19, 1944, in Valley City, North Dakota, to Richardis Wollersheim Bommer and Richard Bommer. Survivors include her sons, Mike Moyers and his partner Deborah Schaan, Kevin Moyers and his wife Judy C. Moyers; her grandchildren, Morgan Moyers, Kimber Moyers, and Kaylee Moyers; sisters, Mary Salberg, Shirley Stagner, Linda Webb; Connie Ruhlman and her brothers, Jimmy Wlaschin and Bobby Wlaschin. She is preceded in death by her parents and her sister, Gloria. Charlene attended Scottsbluff Highschool in Nebraska and graduated in 1962. She then married not too long after and had two sons. She then moved to Texas in 1978 and settled down with her family, where they remained until her death. She was an amazing mother, friend, businesswoman and person. She had a soft heart for her family and love for animals. She was an […]

Paul Wayne Schlett, 62, of Houston, passed from this life on Sunday, August 4, 2024, with family, physician, and friends by his side. He was born on October 5, 1961, in Beaumont, Texas to Ruby Lee Fancher and Paul Henry Schlett. While growing up in Southeast Texas, he became an avid Dallas Cowboys fan as well as a Houston Astros Fan. Participating in school sports, sandlot and organized baseball leagues, Paul gained the reputation of a competitive first baseman with exceptional hitting skills. At ten years old, he was voted to the YMBL Little League All Stars with boys one and two years older than him. After high school, Paul worked a stint with Golden Gators AA Team in Beaumont and afterwards with his father, opened up a baseball memorabilia shop in Beaumont. Later, he received a Bachelor of Science degree as well as a degree in the Paralegal field. […]

Helen Elizabeth Goodhue, 86, of Beaumont, died Friday, August 2, 2024, at Harbor Hospice, Beaumont. She was born on August 1, 1938, to Ellen Elizabeth Whitehead Tucker and Leonard Alvie Tucker, in Luling. Survivors include her children, Bobby McCauley; Mary Pelton and her husband, Curtis; Beatrice Mears; and John Goodhue and his wife, Lauren; twelve grandchildren; seven great-grandchildren; brother, Bobby Leonard Tucker; and numerous friends, extended family, and loved ones. A gathering of Ms. Goodhue’s family and friends will begin at 10:00 a.m., with her funeral service at 11:00 a.m., Thursday, August 8, 2024, at The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, 7785 Weaver Drive, Beaumont. Her interment will follow at Morse Cemetery, Buna, under the direction of Broussard’s, 1605 North Major Drive, Beaumont.

Arnold Thomas Kay, 83, of Fannett, passed away Tuesday, July 30, 2024, with family at his side due to complications of Huntington’s Disease and other illness. Arnold Thomas Kay was born on December 12,1940, in Houston, Texas, during World War II. He grew up on the North side of the downtown Houston area, where he attended Sam Houston High School. After high school, Mr. Kay served in the United States Navy for four years on the Battleship USS Hull. He considered it an honor to serve his country during Vietnam. Mr. and Mrs. Kay were married July 27, 1962, in Houston, Texas. They started a family having two children. Gregory Kay and Michelle Kay. Mr. Kay worked successfully in the sales industry for his career spanning over fifty years. Mr. Kay loved hobbies such as, square dancing, drawing and painting. He has many watercolor drawings and paintings that are enjoyed […]

Robert Lynn Poole, 75, of Beaumont, Texas, went to live with the Lord July 29, 2024, at Harbor Hospice in Beaumont, Texas. Born and raised in Orange, Texas, Lynn was a 1967 graduate of West Orange High School. After graduation, he served in the US Army two years in Fairbanks, Alaska. Upon returning home, he moved to Mauriceville, Texas, and went to work as a carpenter for Gulf Oil Co. In his 40s he decided to go back to school and graduated from the University of Texas Medical Branch at Galveston as an occupational therapist. He went on to get a master’s degree in rehabilitation counseling from Stephen F. Austin State University and worked the next 20 years as an occupational therapist In his 30s Lynn gave his life to the Lord and remained a faithful Christian throughout his life. He is a member of Calvary Baptist Church in Beaumont. […]

Tuan Van Vo, 85, of Beaumont, Texas, passed away Monday, July 29, 2024, at Baptist Hospitals of Southeast Texas, Beaumont. Tuan Van Vo was born March 7, 1939, in Can Tho, Vietnam to Xua Van Vo and Danh Thi Tran. Survivors include his siblings, Phuoc Van Vo and Loi Ngoc Vo; children, Thien Van Vo and his wife, Tam Thu Thi Nguyen; Thanh Thien Vo and her husband, Noi Thanh Nguyen; and Thuy Thanh Thi Vo and her husband Phuc Van Tran; grandchildren, Thu Minh Thi Vo, Thien Hoang Vo, Thanh Minh Vo, Nhan Trong Tran , Dai Thanh Nguyen, Cong Thien Truong, Tran Bao Thanh Nguyen, Kylie Thao Vy Tran, and Carson Nhat Long Tran; great-grandchild, Lam Tue Vo Tran. Tuan is preceded in death by his parents, Xua Van Vo , Danh Thi Tran and siblings, Xuyen Thi Vo and Tu Thi Vo. A gathering of Mr. Vo’s […]

Lee Broussard, 86, of Nome, died Sunday, July 28, 2024. He was born on July 30, 1937, in Beaumont, to Edith Ruby Sherrod and Joseph Hathorne Broussard. Lee was a life-long member of the First Baptist Church in Nome, Texas where he grew up. Lee was an avid hunter and fisher, and there was always a story or two following his outdoor adventures. He enjoyed spending time with his family, whether it be at the lake, supporting kids and grandkids, or just a routine hunting trip. Lee always had his bag packed and ready to go for the next excursion, wherever it may be. Throughout his life, Lee went hunting in Colorado, Alaska, Junction, and elk hunted up until he was 74 years old. He had a lot of pride in his work as a machinist and dedicated thirty-six years to DuPont. Lee was always a helping hand and was […]

Gregory Barnhart, 75, of Beaumont, died Sunday, July 28, 2024. He was born on October 6, 1948, in Charleston, West Virginia, to Catherine Lee Atkins and Gerald Leon Barnhart. Survivors include his wife, Sandi Barnhart; children, Jessica Barnhart, Austin Barnhart and his special friend Jessica Fontenot, and Jason Barnhart, who were his life; siblings, Roger Barnhart, Penny Bass, Barbara Korn, and Cindy Corkran; and his favorite granddog, miss Molli-Jayne. Gregory is preceded in death by his parents. Greg was the man with all the answers. He was a successful and respected business owner, amazing brother, father, husband, & someone who would give his last dime to make sure his family was protected. It is without question he left this world a better place than when he first arrived. A gathering of Mr. Barnhart’s family and friends will be from 2:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m., Saturday, August 3, 2024, at Broussard’s […]

Victoria E. Baumgartner, known affectionately as Vicki, passed away on July 27, 2024, at her home in Beaumont, Texas surrounded by her loving children. She was 78 years old. Born on April 14, 1946, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, she was the beloved daughter of Edward Bilikiewicz and Jane Bergmann. Vicki’s educational journey included an undergraduate degree from Penn State and a master’s degree from Villanova University, both in Pennsylvania. Her passion for education led her to a distinguished career as an elementary school teacher in Colorado, where she was recognized as Co Teacher of the Year and earned the prestigious National Board Teacher certification. Her commitment to education and community was further highlighted when she served as an Olympic Torch Bearer in 2002. Beyond her professional life, Vicki was a woman of many interests including cooking, skiing, hiking, and watching both American football and soccer. Her love for travel took her […]

Bill was born into humble surroundings in 1928. He was the first of two children, and he and his sister were raised in Houston. His father died while serving in the military when he was a young teenager leaving his mother to raise the two of them alone. At 19, his life changed forever when God called him to preach. He responded with his whole heart giving himself unreservedly to the work of the ministry. While serving as the prayer captain for a college age retreat before the school year began, he asked the students to find a prayer partner for the duration of the retreat. Being a man of above average intelligence, he scanned the crowd and asked the prettiest girl to be his partner. It was not long until he set out to win her heart and eventually, she joined him in ministry as his wife and partner. […]

Steven Arthur Kellas, 64, of Lumberton, Texas passed away on July 24, 2024. Steve was born September 21, 1959 in Anchorage, Alaska to Wilfred (Bill) Kellas and Virginia Pickel Kellas. Anyone who knows Steve knew he never slowed down. He worked for numerous oil drilling companies, both on and offshore. His job took him all over the world, and he picked up an understanding of several languages along the way. He was a wonderful provider for his family. Working a 28 days on 28 days off schedule was difficult, but he made the most of his off days. He spent time with family on vacations, and of course, his other love, beekeeping. Most days off you would find him out at his shop working on one beekeeping project or another. He loved sharing his knowledge of bees. Survivors include his wife of 31 years, Kathy Chatelain Kellas; son, Zachary Kellas […]

Karl Lester Knoble, of Beaumont, Texas, passed into the Arms of His Savior, on July 24, 2024. He was born on April 1, 1930, in Easton, Pennsylvania, to Lester and Beulah Knoble. Karl served for 6 years with the U.S. Air Force, including active duty as technical sergeant and Radar instructor during the Korean war. After being discharged from the service, he earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical Engineering at Penn State University, followed by graduate level study at the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia while working for RCA. He said that he would never forget the foundation for his education that he received in a one room schoolhouse one teacher in Old Williams Township, Pennsylvania, where the first 8 grades were taught in one room; and the older children would help the younger children. From 1964 to 1969, he worked for NASA in Houston, and was involved […]

Patricia (Pat) Taylor Touchett passed away in her sleep at the age of 89 on July 23, 2024, at her home. Pat was born in Houston, Texas on September 10, 1934. She was proceeded in death by her parents, Marvin Taylor, and Mabel Dodd nee’ Morrison; her sister, Norma Walker; her beloved husband, Nelson Touchett, Jr.; her stepson, Randy Touchett; and her stepdaughter, Terrie Touchett. She is survived by her son and daughter-in-law, Rick and Laurie Goldin of Lumberton, Texas; her daughter and son-in-law, Cherl and Wilborn Phillips of Rowlett, Texas; stepdaughter, Jan Bach of Silsbee, Texas; daughter-in-law, Jennifer Touchett; as well as her 12 grandchildren: Aaron Goldin, Meagan Koon, Lauren Sachitano, Nicholas Long, Rachael Hefner, Cindy Fish, Jason Phillips, Theresa Peveto, Gregg Bach, Hilary Touchett, Hayley Wigley, Jacob Touchett; and 23, soon to be 24, great-grandchildren. Pat loved her life and had a great time after her retirement from […]

Joan Mayfield Hataway was born on December 26, 1930, in Wichita, Kansas, and died peacefully at home in Beaumont, Texas, on July 19, 2024. Joan was the only child of parents John Lamar Mayfield and Hazel Kathy Mayfield. Joan grew up in Galveston, Texas, and graduated from Ball High School. Later moving with her parents to Beaumont, Joan attended Lamar College of Technology (Lamar Tech), now being Lamar University. During that time, Joan met the love of her life, William “Bill” B. Hataway and shortly thereafter, Bill and Joan were married at First United Methodist Church in Beaumont. Joan and Bill then moved to Austin, where Bill attended the University of Texas, graduating in 1955 as a Petroleum Engineer. Bill and Joan moved to Wink, Texas for Bill’s first job with Stanolind Oil & Gas Company, then on to Lubbock. During that time, Bill & Joan adopted their children, Bill, […]

Elma Rose Jones, 82, of Beaumont, died Thursday, July 18, 2024. She was born on December 15, 1941, to Clara Euileard Barlow and Joseph Briffet Barlow, in Beaumont. Elma was a devoted, hardworking mother and grandmother who would do anything for her family and those she loved. She enjoyed having conversations and never met a stranger. Her favorite color was red and made sure everyone knew so. Aside from her love for her four-legged companions, she also had a deep love for owls and elephants. She spent most of her days doing word searches and watching lifetime movies she had seen a million times already. She loved to bake and spend time painting any project her late husband John would present to her. Elma was truly selfless, she would always go above and beyond for those around her and never expected anything in return. she will be truly and deeply […]

Arthur A. Vigeon, Jr., 80, of Beaumont, died Tuesday, July 16, 2024, at Harbor Hospice, Beaumont. He was born on November 23, 1943, in Beaumont, to Gladys Powell Vigeon and Arthur Adolph Vigeon, Sr. and was a veteran of the United States Army. Survivors include his children, Sharleen Vigeon Newman and her husband, Willie, Vanessa Vigeon, and Tim Blincoe and his wife, Katrina; mother of his children, Lurah Broussard; grandchildren, Jonathon Vigeon and his wife, Kayla, Jessica Dominy and her husband, Logan, Whitney Ledoux and her husband, Chase, Haley Hansel and her husband, Casey, and Katie Newman; ten great-grandchildren; siblings, Charlotte Warren Nicholas and her husband, Charles, Sue Denby and her husband, David, and Joan Lee and her husband, Robert; sister-in-law, Kathy Rascoe; and numerous extended family and loved ones through the years. He is preceded in death by his parents; stepfather, John Rascoe; wife, Donna Blincoe Vigeon; and brothers, […]

Robert Charles “Bobby” Jones went to be with his Lord and Savior on Monday, July 15, 2024, after a lengthy illness from Stage 4 Lymphoma and COPD/Emphysema. Bobby was born on August 13, 1954, in Beaumont, Texas to Raymond C. “Shorty” Jones and Marian B. (McClelland) Jones. Bobby attended Bingman Elementary School and MacArthur Junior High School. He was a 1973 graduate of South Park High School. He attended the Pipefitters Local 195 Apprenticeship Program and became a Journeyman in 1979. Bobby was a dedicated and loyal Union man. Later in his career, he became certified as an Instrument Fitter and continued in that field until retirement in 2016. The majority of his career was spent working in local refineries, only traveling when necessary. Bobby is survived by his sister, Cheryl (Jones) Rinando; brother, David M. Jones and his wife, Cindy; niece, Lisa Yarbro and her husband, Brett; nephew, Mark […]

“Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Enter into the joy of your master!” Matthew 25: 23 Deacon William “Bill” James Gier II, 70, of Beaumont, Texas died Monday, July 15, 2024. He was born November 17, 1953, to William J. Gier and Josephine Lena Krauskopf in Bay City, Texas. Bill grew up in Bay City, Texas. He and his mother moved to Vidor during his high school years, following his father’s death. He graduated from Lamar University with an Associate’s Degree in fire safety management. He began working at MobilOil in 1973 and retired with forty years of service from ExxonMobil. Always a man of service, he spent many years in the Vidor Volunteer Fire Department, including as fire chief, and as a fire inspector for the City of Vidor. Faith, love of […]

Katherine Rinando, 78, of Beaumont, died Monday, July 15, 2024, surrounded by her family. She was born September 19, 1945, to Lee and Pearl Cascio. She was in the first graduating class of Monsignor Kelly Catholic High School in 1963. Shortly after graduation, she met Vincent Rinando, and they married on June 26, 1966. They went on to build their family with four children: Rose, Paula, Vince Jr., and Christopher. She worked alongside her husband at their laundry service, raised their children, and later substituted at St. Anne Catholic School. She loved the beach and everything about it. It was her happy place, walking and collecting shells, fishing and mostly the sunsets. The memories she made with her family there were priceless. She and Pawpaw taught each one of us to fish and crab. She had so much joy catching “the big one” but loved watching her children, grandchildren, and great-grandchildren […]

Billie Ann Thorp Lee was born on 16 February 1928 to parents Lester Lee Roy Thorp and Magdalena “Maggie” Brooks Thorp in Okmulgee, Oklahoma. Billie passed away on 15 July 2024 at Baptist Hospital in Beaumont, TX with her three children beside her bed. Billie grew up in Oklahoma and parts of South Texas following her father who worked in the oil field. She and her mother settled in Houston, Texas when she was 14 years old. Shortly after high school, she became an x-ray technician at Hermann Hospital in Houston. She missed being able to attend Rice University only because of a lack of monetary funding. She spent over 70 years in the medical field including working as an x-ray technician, in a private medical practice, and volunteering for 27 years at Baptist Hospital Emergency Room. With this, she was our go-to person when it came to anything with […]

Jeri Speyrer passed away Saturday, July 13, 2024, just 3 days after her 85th birthday. Jeri was born July 10, 1939, to Hardy Sidney Johnson and Chloyce Elizabeth Henderson Johnson. Raised in Nederland, Texas, Jeri was a Bulldog through and through. She graduated from Nederland High School in 1957 ending her 6-year cheerleading career on the field. She then moved from the field to the stands where she continued to cheer on her Bulldogs as well as her Astros, Cowboys, Rockets, any little league team she knew one of the players be it one of her children, grandchildren or friends of a friend. She loved competition as well as dancing and socializing. She was a line dance instructor at Golden Years until her health would not permit her to continue. She met some very dear friends during this time as she traveled with the “Boot Scooters” performing for area nursing […]

David Lichenstein, 65, of Beaumont, died Tuesday, July 9, 2024. He was born on February 2, 1959, in Woodville, to Mary E. O’Hare and Louis P. Lichenstein. David’s need for speed started at an early age jumping trash cans on his stingray bike. He progressed to racing motorcross in the Astrodome, Governor’s Cup Championships with his Outboard race boats, and on to Drag Bike racing. He qualified in his first national event on his 4.6 second drag bike at Ohio Valley Dragway in Kentucky in May of this year. David’s Professional career led him back to his father’s business, Louis’ Yazoo Sales and Service. David also began building Custom Motorcycles which led to Big Daddy’s Choppers at the same location. David built a relationship with Bad Boy Mowers and has been the #1 Single Location Dealer in the United States for many of the last ten years. Bad Boy Mowers […]

Michael “Mike” Fama, 72, of Beaumont, died Tuesday, July 2, 2024. Mike was born in Beaumont, Texas, to Joseph Fama, MD and Lena Mae “Doodle” Fama. After attending college and pharmacy school, Mike became a registered pharmacist. During his career he worked in retail, institutional and mail order pharmacy before retiring. In his leisure time he truly enjoyed being with family, but also had a wide circle of life-long friends. With family there were many wonderful holiday events that included excellent food and lots of fun and a particular favorite gathering place was the family country retreat in Woodville. Mike was always a huge sports fan. As a young adult he played in local softball leagues. For many years he and a friend made annual trips to Baton Rouge for tailgating and attending LSU games. More recently he and the family would attend Astros games. Mike and his daughter, Emily, […]

Jodi Lynn West, 63, of Beaumont, died Saturday, June 29, 2024. She was born on August 27, 1960, in Chicago, Illinois, to Raymond Zografos. Jodi loved and was loved by her husband, Todd; daughter, Lacie; son, Jason and his wife, Kayla; and grandchildren, Sienna, Alex, and Beau. Let’s not forget her fur babies, Snuggles, Mattie, Jasper, Kaiser, and Duke. Jodi loved participating in 4H and FFA with her children. Jodi was loved by everyone she came in contact with and loved them back. She loved working as a teacher aide at China Elementary for several years. Her most recent job was at Silly Paws Kennel, where she was the Director. She loved the people that worked there and most of all her fur babies. Jodi is preceded in death by her father. A gathering of Mrs. West’s family and friends will be from 5:00 p.m. until 7:00 p.m., Monday, July […]

William Adam Kindon, 35, of Vidor, Texas, died Wednesday, June 26, 2024. He was born on February 16, 1989, to Elizabeth Adams Kindon and William A. “Bill” Kindon, in Shreveport, Lousiana. Survivors include his father, William A. “Bill” Kindon; sister, Jeri Beth Kindon Sterling and her husband, Stephen, of Vidor; grandmother, Sherry Sawyer Adams of Beaumont; and numerous other family members and friends. He is preceded in death by his mother, Elizabeth Adams Kindon and his other grandparents. Adam graduated from Brownsboro High School in 2007. After graduation, Adam moved to Southeast Texas where he was surrounded by friends and family. He loved life and made fast friends with anyone he came across. Adam was kindhearted and was fiercely loyal to his friends and family. He had just started a new job and had big plans for the future. Adam was a huge animal lover and will be missed by […]
